marklogic.body:
I've promised to write my traditional new season assessment prior to game one. Last year I said we we lose Beltran and KROD, sign Reyes and finish 3rd. Oh well! The Wright and Ike injuries and lack of funds defined last year and this one. I'm almost ready to contribute my review but this blog is about Lucas Duda.Duda, Wright, Bay and Davis can in theory hit over 100 home runs and drive in 375. My issue then is who might score these runs. Not Murphy or Torres, at least neither has ever scored over 100. Wright will given health, and perhaps Bay who has and can run the bases.The facts are that Murphy is a natural #3 hitter who strikes out less than Wright and is potentially a better clutch hitter. Tejada may end up hitting second and scoring 90 plus runs if he hits like last year. But lets discuss Duda and Davis. I predict each will hit 30 plus home runs and Duda will get 100 RBIs first. Both will hit over .275 but not without the protection of Jason Bay, who need to play like, well .... Jason Bay. If Bay hits, they all hit, if he fails, well Duda and Davis will each get high OBPs without seeing good pitches to hit and not hit the numbers each is capable of. Duda is great but its a team sport folks. My lineup though definitely not Terry Collins Torres B Too many SO to stay in leadoff Spot .250 will hit 7th or 8th before long Tejada R Will lead Must draw walks, learn to bunt, steal n then score 100 runs Murphy L Natural #3 .305 45 2B 18 HR 85 RBIs 105 runs Wright R Best Spot for David .288 40 2B 24 HR 109 RBIs Davis L Hits his Stride .292 35 2B 31 HR 94 RBIs Duda L Team HR & RBI leader .278 36 2B 37 HR 117 RBIs Bay R The key .272 32 2B 22 HR 86 RBIs Thole &Nickeus Thole can hit .280 with some power.
If Bay fails early, get him out of there. Put in Hairston or trade or promote someone
Then this team can win some games if the pitching holds up.
